it.polimi.ingsw.ps42.view.GUI.dialog

Class IncrementWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • it.polimi.ingsw.ps42.view.GUI.dialog.IncrementWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class IncrementWindow
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    Class that implements a JDialog to show the move the player wants to do. Moreover, this window is used also to increase the action that the player is doing
    Author:
    Luca Napoletano, Claudio Montanari
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • IncrementWindow

        public IncrementWindow(GUIView view,
                       ActionType type,
                       FamiliarColor familiarColor,
                       int position,
                       int actionValue,
                       int maxIncrement)
        Constructor of the IncrementWindow
        Parameters:
        view - The current GUIView on the screen
        type - The type of the action chosen by the user
        familiarColor - The Color of the moved familiar
        position - The position where this familiar will be (e.g 2 floor of the green tower: ActionType = Take_Green, position = 1)
        actionValue - The value of the chosen action
        maxIncrement - The max increment to set correctly the slider (This is the number of slaves that the player has)
